title: @Riot Question on RIven in the cinematic
body:
http://waifu.clan.su/_ld/1/64637561.jpg

Riven came out a lot more beautiful than I though she would be (crazy amount of detail in it), as I pictured her kind of fucked up in the face lol. Anyways, Can we get some clarity as to why her eyes are surrounded by black? And the scar as well. I imagine the scar is just that, a scar, but maybe not. Anyways, is that the natural color of her skin around her eyes, or is that from something else. I don't imagine war paint, but it could be.

replies.body: Nice observation. When we discussed and aligned on Riven's face for this video, we decided that given the circumstances it would be appropriate to take a little license with Riven's traditional "makeup heavy eyes" look and turn it into something battle functional.  In a stadium type setting with intense sunlight beating down on white-ish sand, an athlete (a gladiator sentenced to die, maybe) would definitely like some eye black to prevent sunlight from hurting her ability to perform.

Thanks for that explanation but can we address the elephant in the room?

While we're on the subject of champion looks in the "Awaken" cinematic, why doesn't Draven have his ponytail? Is there any specific reason, or did you guys just forget it was a thing? XD

[This thread](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/GEs12uEy-awaken-shows-we-need-dravens-ponytail-removed-for-his-canon-classic-skin) points it out quite nicely. (I didn't want to go through the trouble of copying the pictures over if there's an existing thread that has them)

it's been over a year since we were in "these" meetings.  IIRC...

For the purposes of this video's storytelling everything is just slightly in the future.  It portrays a plausible, potentially real future.  Riven has clearly been extradited, or captured and thrown in the pits after her present timeline story taking place in Ionia.  In order to portray Draven as just ever so slightly different, we decided to change his costume from participant of the gladiatorial arena to VIP onlooker and presider-over-events fancy guy.  Not so over the hill that he's in government uniform, but not as grimy as he once was.

It's subtle; we didn't want most viewers to even pick up on the nuance because it's ultimately way more important to know that this is the Draven you know and love.  We changed his nappy high fur collar to a much more luxurious pelt slung over his shoulders and cut his hair to be more presentable. We decided he would definitely chafe with this kind of lifestyle so he still remains sleeveless and not well shaven.  The quality of his leathers are (poorly kept) nice dappered leathers even though they're very much layered for combat protection, etc.

Thus, Draven lost a ponytail and much of his mullet.

Speaking of it, were the changes to his Eye-colour and Tattoo's also intended? In the splashart, we see a hint of silver, whereas in the cinematic he has a very clearly visible Yellow Eyecolour,

And his Tattoo-shape is also different. In the Splashart, his tattoo's resemble the image of electrical signal lines in chips you often use to visualize any technology, whereas in the Cinematic he has zigzag tattoo's. And the Tattoo'd arm also changed. In the splashart it's his right hand, but in the clip it is his left.

Are any of those 3 things also intended?
I'm assuming Riven somehow escaped after this, she did take down five guys with her bare hands then beat Draven at his own game.
He's really, really hot in the cinematic I'll have you know

I was right.
Special thanks to my encyclopedic knowledge of useless bullshit.

Black marks around the eyes are used to reduce sun glare while staring out into an open space. Its why Cheetahs have those marks on their face, it helps reduce the sun glare when they stare out across the Savannah looking for prey. Football players put black under their eyes for the same reason. The black across Riven's eyes could be for a similar use.
